summary: Wow Louis really is out there going to a music festival that just so happens to coincidentally by accident be in a city close to...
body: Wow Louis really is out there going to a music festival that just so happens to coincidentally by accident be in a city close to where Harry’s having a concert tonight. Being about as subtle as a punch in the throat.

summary: It's Not Over
title: It's Not Over
body:
The boys from 2017 wake up in 2010 before they became famous.

They Don’t Know About Us - Part 2

Chapter I. - Part 2Louis’ head was hurting so bad that he didn’t open his eyes even when he had been up for at least ten minutes. He was leaning against a cool wall, which was strange, because he…

tags: freaking out over two people who don't even know i exist
summary: *Louis lands in Philadelphia. Harry has a show in Philadelphia. H&L are publicly in the same country. Louis is wearing his own...
body:
*Louis lands in Philadelphia. Harry has a show in Philadelphia. H&L are publicly in the same country. Louis is wearing his own merch.*

Me: Don’t get your hopes up. It’s just a coincidence. This doesn’t mean anything

Also me: OMFG HARRY AND LOUIS ARE IN THE SAME COUNTRY LARRY IS REAL LOUIS IS GOING TO HARRYS SHOW RAINBOW BEARS BLUE&GREEN OOPS&HI ROSEANDDAGGER LOUIS IS WEARING HIS OWN MERCH TAKE MY MONEY BITCH.  

*Screams larry in 28 different languages*

blog.name: harryimaginedstories
blog.title: Harry One Shots
blog.description: writing blog of an aspiring author.  my stories & wattpad page

summary: a good guy
title: a good guy
body:
this is another thought I had and wrote down. hope you enjoy. it’s fairly short and a familiar prompt with a twist on it.

Calling a person in the middle of the night whilst being under the influence of a lot of alcohol, is never a good idea. And if the person you’re trying to reach at that hour is your ex-boyfriend, that idea turns from being fairly bad to absolutely lunatic. 
And still, in that moment, her upset mind couldn’t offer any other idea than to try and contact him, be it just to wake him up and then end the call, or to talk and confess that she still wanted him. 

Their relationship, although calling it that was a bit of a stretch, had broken into pieces a long time ago, and even when it hadn’t been a mutual decision, sober her knew that it had been for the better. 
Harry was a catch, no doubt, but they hadn’t meshed well. By the end of the months spent fooling around, calling the other boyfriend or girlfriend caused a bitter taste in both of their mouths. 
But drunk her wanted to have him back regardless. Drunk her needed to be reminded of how his voice sounded when he was woken up form a deep slumber, be it only so it could help her picture the adorable mess on the top of his head. 
And maybe, she let herself hope, calling him now would get him to come and pick her up. Which in turn would let her see him again, something she so desperately ached for. 

And so she lifted her phone and opened her contact list in search for his name, which she hadn’t deleted even after he’d asked her to. 

The shrill sound of his phone ringing didn’t manage to pull Harry from his sleep. His girlfriend pushing weakly against his shoulder and whining next to his ear did. 

“Good god, Har, turn that off,” Y/N murmured and tried to bury her head in her pillow while simultaneously scooting away from him and his side of the bed where the ringing was coming from, something he prevented by keeping both arms locked around her waist. 

“Shh, it’ll go away on its own,” Harry replied and buried his head into her neck, “Sleep.” 

Like a koala, Harry clung onto her and she whined when his leg draped over her thighs. Y/N tried to believe him and squeezed her eyes shut, waiting for the awful ringing to come to an end. 
But it didn’t. The caller was persistent. Y/N thought she was going to cry. 

“Harry. Please.”

With a loud groan Harry forced himself to sit and reached for his phone.

“Who is it?” Y/N hummed and pulled the covers back up to her chin, “Anne? Gem?” 

Those were the only two people who she would allow to call him in the middle of the night.

“No,” Harry said lowly and frowned, “Don’t know the number. Hello?”

Y/N turned to lay on her side and look at him, at first to ask him to please leave the room and let her sleep, but once she recognized a troubled expression on his face she stopped and instead reached out to rub his wrist softly. 
Where there had previously been peace evident in his features, was now none of it left as it faded away the moment the person on the other side began to talk. 
It was a voice Harry recognized all too well. A voice he hadn’t heard in a long while and that with full intention.

“Why are you calling me at this hour?” Harry asked and his calm and cold manner easily alarmed Y/N.

Whoever he was talking to, couldn’t be a person he liked.

“Harry? Is everything okay?”  

He glanced at her briefly and nodded before his hand found hers and she soothingly drew circles over his knuckles. 
Even when sleep was still trying to pull her under and her eyes were burning the longer she forced them to stay open, Harry’s sudden change in demeanor was enough to keep her up.

“No, are you serious?” Harry exclaimed, “I can’t- no, of course not, but- hey, stop messing around that’s not gonna happen!” 

“Who is it?”

Harry glanced at her quickly and squeezed her fingers. “Listen, I really can’t do- okay. Yes, but I this isn’t- no. No. Of course I don’t want you to- Yeah, fine. I’ll- Okay, yeah, I’ll be there. Text me the address.”

The minute he set his phone aside, Harry let himself fall back into the pillows. Y/N observed him closely with worry growing in her tummy and once he looked at her, she knew that he had unpleasant news. 

“Who was it?” Y/N asked again, hand reaching up to caress his cheek softly.

She noticed a short stumble growing there and she giggled when he turned his head to kiss her palm.
His eyes shone and slowly the smile on her face froze. 

“You have something to say that you’d rather I didn’t know,” she murmured and Harry sighed at how well she knew him.

He tried to look away but her gaze was too enchanting. He swallowed hard. 

“It was Lina.” 

“Lina?” Y/N thought about it for a moment, trying to figure out why she knew that name, and once it dawned on her, her mouth fell open, “Oh, no way!”

Every last ounce of sleep was pulled from her by the sound of that name. Y/N shot up and so did Harry, hands already reaching for her again. She was quick to shrug him off though and pushed him away.

“Y/N, I’m sorry. I-”

“What did she want?” she snapped and sat on her knees, facing Harry with a stare that was burning, “Why does she have your number? What did she say?”

“She’s drunk and at some bar east from-”

“And what did you mean you’ll be there?” 

Harry’s shoulders slumped and Y/N was mortified to watch him climb out of bed and reach for the pair of jeans that hung over the chair by his side. 
With one leg already in the clothing he turned to look at her and tried to smile. 

“She needs me to come pick her up.”

Y/N’s hands rubbed her cheeks and she shook her head. Her Harry was leaving their bed to go to a woman he’d slept with on multiple occasions who also was drunk. And who she knew was still obsessed with him. What could possibly go wrong?

“I don’t even know what to say.”

“I’m sorry,” he said sincerely and pouted, hoping to ease her, though that he was fastening his belt around his slim hips and searching for his shoes, didn’t make anything better, “But what else am I gonna do?”

“She’s unbelievable.” Y/N sighed and let her body fall back onto the soft mattress. 

Her gaze was set on the ceiling and Harry’s tummy fluttered at the sight of her scowling. 

“Y/N.”

Harry pulled the jumper she’d worn the day before over his head before crawling back onto the bed so he could reach for her. For a moment he worried she might fight him off, but then she let him move closer and he relaxed. His hands gently rubbed her thighs, trying to get her to give him her attention again. 

“Y/N, please. Don’t want you to be mad at me.”

He squeezed her knees and smiled when she finally met his eyes again. 

“I’m not mad at you, Har,” she finally muttered unwillingly, “it’s her who I would want to strangle right now. How dare she?”

His phone made a brief sound, indicating a text message and he could practically see the blood boil in her veins. 
Though he felt wrong about it, he couldn’t go without knowing that Y/N was alright and that he wasn’t disappointing her. She was his girlfriend now. His priority. Not Lina.

“If you really want me to stay then m’not leaving. Someone else can go pick her up and-”

“No, no, no, no,” Y/N reached for his hands and pulled them up so he was touching her cheeks, “You have to go and be there for her. You already promised and… well, you’re the only dork who doesn’t turn the sounds off on their phone during the night so I don’t think she could find somebody who would go and get her.”

“So,” Harry crawled further to her and pressed a quick kiss to her cheek, “It’s okay that I’ll head out for a moment?”

She scowled. But nodded. “Yeah. You’re a good guy. This makes you a really, really, wondefull guy.”

Harry kissed her mouth. His forehead brushed hers and she closed her eyes before reopening them to meet his warm ones. 

“You can tell me no,” he murmured.

“I won’t though. Go. It’s alright. But don’t you bring her here, okay? She can at least sleep it off at her own place.”

“Of course, my love,” he replied and hushed another peck to her mouth before raising to move off the bed, “I’ll be back soon, promise.”

hope you enjoyed this one. thank you for reading! also I wrote and uploaded this in a starbucks and their internet is slow so I hope it works!

“And what did you mean you’ll be there?” 

Harry’s shoulders slumped and Y/N was mortified to watch him climb out of bed and reach for the pair of jeans that hung over the chair by his side. 
With one leg already in the clothing he turned to look at her and tried to smile. 

“She needs me to come pick her up.”

Y/N’s hands rubbed her cheeks and she shook her head. Her Harry was leaving their bed to go to a woman he’d slept with on multiple occasions who also was drunk. And who she knew was still obsessed with him. What could possibly go wrong?

“I don’t even know what to say.”

“I’m sorry,” he said sincerely and pouted, hoping to ease her, though that he was fastening his belt around his slim hips and searching for his shoes, didn’t make anything better, “But what else am I gonna do?”

“She’s unbelievable.” Y/N sighed and let her body fall back onto the soft mattress. 

Her gaze was set on the ceiling and Harry’s tummy fluttered at the sight of her scowling. 

“Y/N.”

Harry pulled the jumper she’d worn the day before over his head before crawling back onto the bed so he could reach for her. For a moment he worried she might fight him off, but then she let him move closer and he relaxed. His hands gently rubbed her thighs, trying to get her to give him her attention again. 

“Y/N, please. Don’t want you to be mad at me.”

He squeezed her knees and smiled when she finally met his eyes again. 

“I’m not mad at you, Har,” she finally muttered unwillingly, “it’s her who I would want to strangle right now. How dare she?”

His phone made a brief sound, indicating a text message and he could practically see the blood boil in her veins. 
Though he felt wrong about it, he couldn’t go without knowing that Y/N was alright and that he wasn’t disappointing her. She was his girlfriend now. His priority. Not Lina.

“If you really want me to stay then m’not leaving. Someone else can go pick her up and-”

“No, no, no, no,” Y/N reached for his hands and pulled them up so he was touching her cheeks, “You have to go and be there for her. You already promised and… well, you’re the only dork who doesn’t turn the sounds off on their phone during the night so I don’t think she could find somebody who would go and get her.”

“So,” Harry crawled further to her and pressed a quick kiss to her cheek, “It’s okay that I’ll head out for a moment?”

She scowled. But nodded. “Yeah. You’re a good guy. This makes you a really, really, wondefull guy.”

Harry kissed her mouth. His forehead brushed hers and she closed her eyes before reopening them to meet his warm ones. 

“You can tell me no,” he murmured.

“I won’t though. Go. It’s alright. But don’t you bring her here, okay? She can at least sleep it off at her own place.”

“Of course, my love,” he replied and hushed another peck to her mouth before raising to move off the bed, “I’ll be back soon, promise.”

hope you enjoyed this one. thank you for reading! also I wrote and uploaded this in a starbucks and their internet is slow so I hope it works!

Masterlist
trail.content:
this is another thought I had and wrote down. hope you enjoy. it’s fairly short and a familiar prompt with a twist on it.

Calling a person in the middle of the night whilst being under the influence of a lot of alcohol, is never a good idea. And if the person you’re trying to reach at that hour is your ex-boyfriend, that idea turns from being fairly bad to absolutely lunatic. 
And still, in that moment, her upset mind couldn’t offer any other idea than to try and contact him, be it just to wake him up and then end the call, or to talk and confess that she still wanted him. 

Their relationship, although calling it that was a bit of a stretch, had broken into pieces a long time ago, and even when it hadn’t been a mutual decision, sober her knew that it had been for the better. 
Harry was a catch, no doubt, but they hadn’t meshed well. By the end of the months spent fooling around, calling the other boyfriend or girlfriend caused a bitter taste in both of their mouths. 
But drunk her wanted to have him back regardless. Drunk her needed to be reminded of how his voice sounded when he was woken up form a deep slumber, be it only so it could help her picture the adorable mess on the top of his head. 
And maybe, she let herself hope, calling him now would get him to come and pick her up. Which in turn would let her see him again, something she so desperately ached for. 

And so she lifted her phone and opened her contact list in search for his name, which she hadn’t deleted even after he’d asked her to. 

The shrill sound of his phone ringing didn’t manage to pull Harry from his sleep. His girlfriend pushing weakly against his shoulder and whining next to his ear did. 

“Good god, Har, turn that off,” Y/N murmured and tried to bury her head in her pillow while simultaneously scooting away from him and his side of the bed where the ringing was coming from, something he prevented by keeping both arms locked around her waist. 

“Shh, it’ll go away on its own,” Harry replied and buried his head into her neck, “Sleep.” 

Like a koala, Harry clung onto her and she whined when his leg draped over her thighs. Y/N tried to believe him and squeezed her eyes shut, waiting for the awful ringing to come to an end. 
But it didn’t. The caller was persistent. Y/N thought she was going to cry. 

“Harry. Please.”

With a loud groan Harry forced himself to sit and reached for his phone.

“Who is it?” Y/N hummed and pulled the covers back up to her chin, “Anne? Gem?” 

Those were the only two people who she would allow to call him in the middle of the night.

“No,” Harry said lowly and frowned, “Don’t know the number. Hello?”

Y/N turned to lay on her side and look at him, at first to ask him to please leave the room and let her sleep, but once she recognized a troubled expression on his face she stopped and instead reached out to rub his wrist softly. 
Where there had previously been peace evident in his features, was now none of it left as it faded away the moment the person on the other side began to talk. 
It was a voice Harry recognized all too well. A voice he hadn’t heard in a long while and that with full intention.

“Why are you calling me at this hour?” Harry asked and his calm and cold manner easily alarmed Y/N.

Whoever he was talking to, couldn’t be a person he liked.

“Harry? Is everything okay?”  

He glanced at her briefly and nodded before his hand found hers and she soothingly drew circles over his knuckles. 
Even when sleep was still trying to pull her under and her eyes were burning the longer she forced them to stay open, Harry’s sudden change in demeanor was enough to keep her up.

“No, are you serious?” Harry exclaimed, “I can’t- no, of course not, but- hey, stop messing around that’s not gonna happen!” 

“Who is it?”

Harry glanced at her quickly and squeezed her fingers. “Listen, I really can’t do- okay. Yes, but I this isn’t- no. No. Of course I don’t want you to- Yeah, fine. I’ll- Okay, yeah, I’ll be there. Text me the address.”

The minute he set his phone aside, Harry let himself fall back into the pillows. Y/N observed him closely with worry growing in her tummy and once he looked at her, she knew that he had unpleasant news. 

“Who was it?” Y/N asked again, hand reaching up to caress his cheek softly.

She noticed a short stumble growing there and she giggled when he turned his head to kiss her palm.
His eyes shone and slowly the smile on her face froze. 

“You have something to say that you’d rather I didn’t know,” she murmured and Harry sighed at how well she knew him.

He tried to look away but her gaze was too enchanting. He swallowed hard. 

“It was Lina.” 

“Lina?” Y/N thought about it for a moment, trying to figure out why she knew that name, and once it dawned on her, her mouth fell open, “Oh, no way!”

Every last ounce of sleep was pulled from her by the sound of that name. Y/N shot up and so did Harry, hands already reaching for her again. She was quick to shrug him off though and pushed him away.

“Y/N, I’m sorry. I-”

“What did she want?” she snapped and sat on her knees, facing Harry with a stare that was burning, “Why does she have your number? What did she say?”

“She’s drunk and at some bar east from-”

“And what did you mean you’ll be there?” 

Harry’s shoulders slumped and Y/N was mortified to watch him climb out of bed and reach for the pair of jeans that hung over the chair by his side. 
With one leg already in the clothing he turned to look at her and tried to smile. 

“She needs me to come pick her up.”

Y/N’s hands rubbed her cheeks and she shook her head. Her Harry was leaving their bed to go to a woman he’d slept with on multiple occasions who also was drunk. And who she knew was still obsessed with him. What could possibly go wrong?

“I don’t even know what to say.”

“I’m sorry,” he said sincerely and pouted, hoping to ease her, though that he was fastening his belt around his slim hips and searching for his shoes, didn’t make anything better, “But what else am I gonna do?”

“She’s unbelievable.” Y/N sighed and let her body fall back onto the soft mattress. 

Her gaze was set on the ceiling and Harry’s tummy fluttered at the sight of her scowling. 

“Y/N.”

Harry pulled the jumper she’d worn the day before over his head before crawling back onto the bed so he could reach for her. For a moment he worried she might fight him off, but then she let him move closer and he relaxed. His hands gently rubbed her thighs, trying to get her to give him her attention again. 

“Y/N, please. Don’t want you to be mad at me.”

He squeezed her knees and smiled when she finally met his eyes again. 

“I’m not mad at you, Har,” she finally muttered unwillingly, “it’s her who I would want to strangle right now. How dare she?”

His phone made a brief sound, indicating a text message and he could practically see the blood boil in her veins. 
Though he felt wrong about it, he couldn’t go without knowing that Y/N was alright and that he wasn’t disappointing her. She was his girlfriend now. His priority. Not Lina.

“If you really want me to stay then m’not leaving. Someone else can go pick her up and-”

“No, no, no, no,” Y/N reached for his hands and pulled them up so he was touching her cheeks, “You have to go and be there for her. You already promised and… well, you’re the only dork who doesn’t turn the sounds off on their phone during the night so I don’t think she could find somebody who would go and get her.”

“So,” Harry crawled further to her and pressed a quick kiss to her cheek, “It’s okay that I’ll head out for a moment?”

She scowled. But nodded. “Yeah. You’re a good guy. This makes you a really, really, wondefull guy.”

Harry kissed her mouth. His forehead brushed hers and she closed her eyes before reopening them to meet his warm ones. 

“You can tell me no,” he murmured.

“I won’t though. Go. It’s alright. But don’t you bring her here, okay? She can at least sleep it off at her own place.”

“Of course, my love,” he replied and hushed another peck to her mouth before raising to move off the bed, “I’ll be back soon, promise.”
